channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What was 'Operation Allies Welcome,' which allowed some Afghans entry into the U.S.?
item.description: The Afghan man suspected of shooting two National Guard members entered the U.S. under the program in 2021. Here's a look at why it was set up and how those who entered the U.S. were vetted.
item.content:encoded:
The Afghan man suspected of shooting two National Guard members entered the U.S. under the program in 2021. Here's a look at why it was set up and how those who entered the U.S. were vetted.

(Image credit: Anthony Peltier)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: National Guard shooting suspect served in CIA counterterrorism unit, group says
item.description: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the Afghan man who allegedly shot two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., had served in one of Afghanistan's elite counterterrorism units, according to a nonprofit run by people who served in Afghanistan.
item.content:encoded:
Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the Afghan man who allegedly shot two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., had served in one of Afghanistan's elite counterterrorism units, according to a nonprofit run by people who served in Afghanistan.

(Image credit: U.S. Attorney’s Office)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: Trump says U.S. envoy returning to Moscow for new Ukraine peace talks
item.description: President Trump says says his envoy Steve Witkoff will resume talks with Putin amid hopes for a Ukraine peace deal, even as leaked transcripts raise questions about Witkoff's role as a mediator.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says says his envoy Steve Witkoff will resume talks with Putin amid hopes for a Ukraine peace deal, even as leaked transcripts raise questions about Witkoff's role as a mediator.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: 'It's not a game': Ukraine's U.S. envoy says peace plan must ensure no Russian aggression
item.description: Just a few months into Olga Stefanishyna's job as Ukraine's ambassador to the U.S, she is helping negotiate a peace deal that could end Russia's war on Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
Just a few months into Olga Stefanishyna's job as Ukraine's ambassador to the U.S, she is helping negotiate a peace deal that could end Russia's war on Ukraine.

(Image credit: Attila Kisbenedek)
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: 'A giant game of chicken': Trump's Venezuela standoff edges toward conflict
item.description: As Washington escalates pressure on Venezuela, any push for regime change risks becoming a costly, dangerous gamble — not the quick fix President Trump might hope for.
item.content:encoded:
As Washington escalates pressure on Venezuela, any push for regime change risks becoming a costly, dangerous gamble — not the quick fix President Trump might hope for.

(Image credit: Jesus Vargas)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Pope Leo XIV embarks on first overseas trip, visiting Turkey and Lebanon
item.description: One journalist gifted Pope Leo XIV a Thanksgiving pumpkin pie as he began his first overseas tour to Turkey and Lebanon, accompanied by the world's press.
item.content:encoded:
One journalist gifted Pope Leo XIV a Thanksgiving pumpkin pie as he began his first overseas tour to Turkey and Lebanon, accompanied by the world's press.

(Image credit: Domenico Stinellis)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Dozens killed, hundreds missing after Hong Kong high-rise blaze
item.description: A massive fire tore through a high-rise housing complex in Hong Kong on Wednesday. Authorities say dozens of people have died and hundreds are missing.
item.content:encoded: A massive fire tore through a high-rise housing complex in Hong Kong on Wednesday. Authorities say dozens of people have died and hundreds are missing.
item.dc:creator: Sherisse Pham

item.title: Former U.S. diplomat Kurt Volker on how Trump is handling Ukraine negotiations
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with former U.S. Special Representative for Ukraine Kurt Volker, about the latest in the Trump administration's unconventional approach to negotiating a peace deal.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with former U.S. Special Representative for Ukraine Kurt Volker, about the latest in the Trump administration's unconventional approach to negotiating a peace deal.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Soldiers in Guinea-Bissau announce their government takeover on state TV
item.description: Soldiers in Guinea-Bissau appeared on state TV saying they have seized power in the country, following reports of gunshots near the presidential palace.
item.content:encoded:
Soldiers in Guinea-Bissau appeared on state TV saying they have seized power in the country, following reports of gunshots near the presidential palace.

(Image credit: TGB Guinea-Bissau)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Death toll in Hong Kong high-rise fire rises to 94, with hundreds still missing
item.description: Hong Kong authorities say at least 94 people have died killed in the fire that spread through a dense high-rise residential housing complex Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
Hong Kong authorities say at least 94 people have died killed in the fire that spread through a dense high-rise residential housing complex Wednesday.

(Image credit: Yan Zhao)
item.dc:creator: Sherisse Pham
